intro: Trigonotis archboldii, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its habitat. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
